Lentil and Spinach Curry

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to a flavorful journey through the vibrant world of lentil and spinach curry! This dish is not just a delight for the taste buds; it’s also packed with nutrients, making it a fantastic choice for those seeking a healthy yet satisfying meal. Lentils, known for their high protein and fiber content, combine perfectly with fresh spinach, creating a dish that’s both hearty and wholesome. The creamy coconut milk adds a rich texture, while the aromatic spices elevate the flavor to new heights. Whether you are a seasoned cook or a beginner in the kitchen, this easy lentil and spinach curry recipe will become a staple in your home. Perfect for weeknight dinners or meal prep, it’s vegan-friendly and can be made in under 30 minutes. Let’s dive into this delicious recipe that celebrates the goodness of plant-based ingredients!

Ingredients

lentils (red or green)

Choose red lentils for a quicker cooking time and a softer texture, or green lentils for a firmer bite. If you don't have lentils, try using split peas or chickpeas, but adjust the cooking time accordingly. Always rinse lentils before cooking to remove any debris.

fresh spinach

Use fresh spinach for the best flavor and texture, but you can substitute with frozen spinach if fresh is unavailable; just thaw and drain excess water before adding. For a different flavor, consider using kale or Swiss chard.

coconut milk

Canned coconut milk gives a rich, creamy texture. If you prefer a lighter option, use light coconut milk or substitute with almond milk, but note that the flavor will be less rich. You can also add a tablespoon of coconut oil for a coconut flavor.

curry powder

Curry powder varies in spice and flavor; taste your curry powder before adding to gauge its strength. If you don't have curry powder, use a mix of cumin, coriander, turmeric, and a pinch of chili powder. Freshly ground spices will enhance the flavor.

garlic (minced)

Fresh garlic provides the best flavor, but you can use garlic powder in a pinch (1/8 teaspoon for each clove). If you want a milder garlic flavor, sauté it for a shorter time.

onion (chopped)

Yellow onions are the best choice for sweetness, but you can use red or white onions as substitutes. If you're short on time, consider using shallots for a milder flavor. For a sweeter taste, sauté the onions longer until caramelized.

vegetable broth

Use low-sodium vegetable broth to control the salt level in your dish. If you don't have vegetable broth, you can use water with added herbs or bouillon cubes for flavor.

olive oil

Olive oil is great for sautéing, but you can substitute with coconut oil for a tropical flavor or canola oil for a neutral taste. Use extra virgin olive oil for the best flavor.

salt

Add salt gradually to taste, as it's easier to add than to remove. Consider using sea salt or Himalayan salt for a different flavor profile.

pepper

Freshly ground black pepper enhances flavor better than pre-ground. For a kick, try using white pepper or adding a pinch of cayenne pepper for heat.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Heat Olive Oil

    In a large pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Make sure the oil is hot enough before adding the next ingredients to ensure they sauté properly.

  • Step 2: Sauté Onion and Garlic

    Add 1 chopped medium onion and 2 minced garlic cloves to the pot. Sauté for about 3-4 minutes until the onion becomes translucent and the garlic is fragrant. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.

  • Step 3: Add Curry Powder

    Stir in 2 tablespoons of curry powder. Cook for another minute, allowing the spices to release their flavors. This step is crucial as it builds the base flavor for your curry.

  • Step 4: Add Lentils and Broth

    Add 1 cup of lentils (red or green) and 2 cups of vegetable broth to the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer. Let it cook for about 15 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.

  • Step 5: Incorporate Coconut Milk and Spinach

    Pour in 1 can (13.5 oz) of coconut milk and add 2 cups of fresh spinach. Stir the mixture until the spinach wilts, which should take about 2-3 minutes. The coconut milk creates a creamy texture that balances the spices.

  • Step 6: Season and Serve

    Season with salt and pepper to taste. Adjust the seasoning based on your preference. Serve warm, and enjoy your delicious lentil and spinach curry!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare lentils before cooking?

Rinse the lentils under cold water in a sieve to remove any dust or debris. There's no need to soak them, especially if you're using red lentils, which cook quickly.

What type of spinach should I use for this recipe?

Fresh spinach is ideal for this curry. You can use baby spinach or regular spinach, but make sure to wash it thoroughly to remove any grit.

How do I know when the lentils are tender?

Lentils are ready when they are soft and can be easily mashed with a fork. Make sure to taste them a few minutes before the recommended cooking time to check for doneness.

Can I use frozen spinach instead of fresh?

Yes! If using frozen spinach, add it directly to the pot along with the coconut milk and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.

What can I do if my curry is too thick?

If your curry is too thick, simply add a bit more vegetable broth or water to reach your desired consistency.

How can I adjust the spice level of the curry?

To make the curry spicier, you can add a pinch of cayenne pepper or a diced jalapeño when sautéing the onions and garlic. For a milder flavor, reduce the amount of curry powder.

What is the best way to store leftovers?

Let the curry cool completely before transferring it to an airtight container. It can be stored in the fridge for up to 3-4 days or frozen for up to 3 months.

What kitchen tools do I need for this recipe?

You'll need a large pot, a cutting board, a knife, a sieve for rinsing lentils, and measuring cups and spoons. A wooden spoon is great for stirring.

How do I safely handle hot pots and pans?

Always use oven mitts when handling hot pots and pans. Keep the handles turned inward on the stove to prevent accidental spills.

What should I do if I accidentally add too much salt or seasoning?

If your dish is too salty, you can balance it out by adding more coconut milk or a little sugar. Taste as you go for the best results.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish is vegan and gluten-free, making it suitable for a variety of dietary preferences. For those avoiding coconut milk, almond milk or cashew cream can be used as alternatives, though they will alter the flavor profile slightly. Ensure the curry powder is gluten-free if needed.

Pairings

This Lentil and Spinach Curry pairs wonderfully with fluffy basmati rice or warm naan bread. For a protein boost, consider serving it with grilled chicken or shrimp marinated in a light lemon and herb dressing. On the beverage side, a crisp Sauvignon Blanc or a refreshing mango lassi complements the curry's warmth well.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the curry in a deep bowl, garnished with fresh cilantro and a squeeze of lime for brightness. Consider adding a dollop of yogurt on top to balance the spices. A side of pickled vegetables can add an extra crunch and tanginess, elevating the meal. For a complete meal, present it alongside a simple cucumber salad tossed in a light vinaigrette.

#

Lentil and Spinach Curry

35 min
$8
250 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Dietary Tags:

VeganGluten-FreeHigh Protein

Cuisine:

IndianAmerican

Course:

Main CourseVegetarian

Tags:

Quick MealHealthyComfort Food

Description

A comforting and nutritious curry with lentils and spinach, perfect for a quick meal!

Ingredients

  • lentils (red or green): 1 cup
  • fresh spinach: 2 cups
  • coconut milk: 1 can (13.5 oz)
  • curry powder: 2 tablespoons
  • garlic (minced): 2 cloves
  • onion (chopped): 1 medium
  • vegetable broth: 2 cups
  • olive oil: 1 tablespoon
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste

Date Created:

11/17/2024
